The hospital I was at when I had my first let me stay even though I had been discharged. She wasn't in nicu though so we were able to stay in the same room bc I wasn't going anywhere without my baby and they knew it. Lol... I forget what the technical term for it is, but it was almost like I was her visitor and could sleep in the room with her and  they even still gave me meals and everything even though they didn't have to do that part. I know that other hospitals offer renting rooms as well so you can stay and be with babe, but idk how much something like that would run, just wanted to share that with you in case you wanted to look into a way to stay with baby. But sounds like he is doing great and will be home with you soon regardless. Good luck and congrats on your new bundle of joy!! :-)

I feel ya. I also had my baby 4 days ago for the same reason as you. I ended up having a c section. I was discharged yesterday and my baby is still in the hospital. It's so hard to leave him but i know he's in good hands.

Thank u all. N yes its gonna b though to leave without him but at home is my big baby my 5yr. Old that i miss so much. N i know that my baby will b in good hands here in the hospital n i know God is good n is protecting my lil man. I was feeling a lil depressed today but thru prayer n family im doing ok.

question: My Prince was born on April 9 at 34 Weeks n 2 days due to preeclampsia. He's getting stronger n better as the days go bye. Thank God he doesn't have any major medical problems.
